Fees must be paid to Flywire in one of two ways

Two transactions, one of principal to PayZen from user, and one of fee to Flywire

One transaction, where PayZen immediately routes monies to Flywire via ACH.

We follow a similar process for sweeping funds to different investor accounts

Current State

Future State

We would need to route $3.95 to FW for each payment collected.

 

Balance Adjustment Offboard
If FW cancels the plan due to the balance increasing beyond $30k, we must follow a different cancelation process as per our normal cancellation process.

Normal Cancelation Process

Please see Cancel Plan Automation for details. TL;DR we will refund the patient if they paid PayZen more than what was owed. This will not be done via an API, our staff will manage.

We have to update the plan when this happens and send a webhook to Flywire.

Provider Funded Offboard

If a plan is adjusted to be over $30k, our partners must tell us why the plan is canceled, specifically for this reason; TL;DR cancelation logic will be that we refund all funds to the provider and mark adjustments / net-settle as we typically do (we do not refund patient payments to the patient, but to the provider and simply mark down the balance)—Balance Adjustment | General Rules .

 

Asset Purchase Requirements
Support the ability for FW to create plans in PayZen with existing balances

Create a new endpoint for FW to onboard these servicing transfer plans

Follow the process we used to board plans with Scratch (Migration endpoint w/ Peach)

Create payment plan agreements and receivables for these individuals, collate records from FW of when users agreed to their terms.

:art: User interaction and design
We must present users a new total payment plan amount for modification purposes. We must call out that the service fee is a “Flywire Fee.” We can leverage the same heuristics as FW, see below. FW document this here.
